N ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE POWERS AND FUNCTIONS OF THE
COMPETENT  AUTHORITY  APPOINTED  BY THE ELECTION
COMMISSION  UNDER THE CONSTITUTION   ; AND TO PROVIDE FOR
MATTERS CONNECTED  THEREWITH  OR INCIDENTAL  THERETO
BE it enacted by the Parliament of the Democratic Socialist
Republic of Sri Lanka as follows :—
1.This Act may be cited as the Competent Authority
(Powers and Functions) Act, No. 3  of 2002.
2.The Competent Authority appointed under sub-
paragraph ( c) of paragraph (5) of Article 104B of the
Constitution (hereinafter referred to as the “CompetentAuthority”) to take over the management of the Sri LankaBroadcasting Corporation or the Sri Lanka RupavahiniCorporation, as the case may be, shall exercise and dischargethe following powers and functions :—
(a) carry on the radio or television broadcasting services,
as the case may be, while maintaining in the publicinterest and in the conduct of a free and fair electionor referendum, high standards in programming ;
(b) register persons engaged in the production of
television or radio programmes relating to an electionor a referendum, as the case may be, whichprogrammes are intended to be broadcast ;
(c) exercise supervision and control over programmes
broadcast by the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporationor the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation, as the casemay be, relating to an election or a referendum ;
(d) advise the Minister in respect of matters relating to
broadcasting which are connected with the holdingof an election or a referendum ;Short Title.
Powers and
functions of theCompetentAuthority.

(e) exercise and perform in relation to any broadcast
pertaining to an election or a referendum as the casemay be, all such powers and functions as are conferredor imposed on or assigned to, either the Sri LankaBroadcasting Corporation or the Sri Lanka RupavahiniCorporation as the case may be, by the Sri LankaBroadcasting Corporation  Act, No. 37 of 1966 or theSri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation Act, No. 6 of 1982respectively ;
(f) establish, install and operate broadcasting apparatus ;
(g) acquire by way of lease, sublease or otherwise any
land or interest in land, with or without any building ;
(h) erect, alter or reconstruct any broadcasting apparatus
or any building or structure on any land belonging toor administered by the Sri Lanka BroadcastingCorporation or the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation,as the case may be, for the use in connection with anybroadcasting station or in connection with the exerciseand discharge of its powers and functions ;
(i) acquire by lease or otherwise, during the period for
which the Competent Authority is appointed, anyproperty, rights or privileges that it considers necessaryfor exercising and discharging of its powers andfunctions ;
(j) with the prior approval of the Election Commission
and subject to any other terms and conditions whichmay be imposed in that behalf, advance money to anyperson or body of persons whether incorporated orunincorporated, producing or intending to produceprogrammes for broadcast,  pertaining to the electionor a referendum, as the case may be, whether inconjunction with any other business or not, or give inrespect of any advance made to any such person orbody of persons as aforesaid by a second person, anyguarantee, indemnity or security ;

Lanka Broadcasting Corporation or the Sri LankaRupavahini Corporation, as the case may be, in sucha manner as the Competent Authority considers fit forthe purpose of promoting and assisting any broadcastpertaining to an election or a referendum ;
(l) during the period for which the Competent Authority
is appointed, take on lease or rent houses, sites anderect houses for the use of such officers and servantsappointed by such Authority ;
(m) publish or arrange for the publication of such
periodicals or other publications as it considersnecessary or beneficial ;
(n) refuse to televise, record or broadcast any
advertisement in any form, the televising, recordingor boardcasting of which is not in the public interest ;
(o) act in combination or association with any person or
body of persons, whether incorporated orunincorporated, within Sri Lanka or abroad, in theexercise or discharge of the powers or functionsspecified in the section ; and
(p) do all such acts or things which in the opinion of the
Competent Authority is necessary for the conduct ofa free and fair election or, a referendum, as the casemay be.
3.In the exercise and discharge of the powers and
functions under paragraphs ( a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) of section
2, it shall be the duty of the Competent Authority as far aspracticable, to be satisfied, that the programmes broadcast bythe Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation or the Sri LankaRupavahini Corporation as the case may be, comply with thefollowing conditions, in addition to any guidelines which theElection Commission may issue from time to time :—
(a) that any programme broadcast by either the Sri Lanka
Broadcasting Corporation or the Sri Lanka RupavahiniCorporation as the case may be, shall not include

Act, No. 4 of 20021
[Certified on 25th March, 2002]

N ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE CONSTITUTION  OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE
APPEALS TRIBUNAL; TO SPECIFY THE POWERS OF SUCH TRIBUNAL
AND THE PROCEDURE  TO BE ADHERED TO BY SUCH TRIBUNAL IN
RESPECT OF APPEALS AND TO PROVIDE FOR MATTERS CONNECTED
THEREWITH  OR INCIDENTAL  THERETO
BE it therefore enacted by the Parliament of the Democratic
Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka as follows :—
1.This Act may be cited as the  Administrative Appeals
Tribunal  Act, No. 4 of 2002.
2.(1) The Administrative Appeals Tribunal established
under paragraph (1) of Article 59 of the Constitution,
(hereinafter referred to as the “Tribunal”) shall consist of three
members appointed by the Judicial Service Commission, from
among persons who have had over twenty years of experience
as a public officer or ten years of experience in the legal
profession, one of whom shall be appointed it’s Chairman.
(2) The terms of office of the members of the Tribunal,
including it’s  Chairman, shall be three years.
3.The Tribunal shall have the power to hear and
determine any appeal preferred to it from any order or decision
made by—
(a) the Public Servie Commision in the exercise of its
powers under Chapter IX of the Constitution;
(b) the National Police Commission in the exercise of  its
powers under Chapter XVIIIA of the Constitution.
4.(1) Any public officer or police officer as the case may
be, aggrieved by an order or decision made by the Public
Service Commission or the National Police Commission, asProcedure for

Removal of Officers (Procedure)
Act, No. 5 of 20021
2—H 013394—5,550 (02/2002)[Certified on 26th March, 2002]
L. D.— O. 6/2002.A
N ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE PROCEDURE  TO BE FOLLOWED  FOR
THE REMOVAL OF PERSONS APPOINTED  TO CERTAIN  OFFICES  SPECIFIED
IN PART II OF THE SCHEDULE  TO  ARTICLE  41C  OF  THE
CONSTITUTION  ;   AND  TO  PROVIDE  FOR  MATTERS  CONNECTED
THEREWITH  OR INCIDENTAL  THERETO
BE it enacted by the Parliament of the Democratic Socialist
Republic of Sri Lanka as follows :—
1. This Act may be cited as the Removal of Officers
(Procedure) Act, No. 5 of 2002.
2.The holders of the Office of—
(a) the Attorney - General;
(b) the Inspector -General of Police,
shall not be removed from such Office, except in
accordance with the procedure as set out hereinafter inthis Act.
3. The persons appointed to the Offices referred to in
section 2 may be removed from office on any one or more ofthe following grounds :—
(a) being adjudged an insolvent by a court of competent
jurisdiction ;
(b) being unfit to continue in office by reason of ill health
or physical or mental infirmity ;
(c) being convicted of an offence involving  moral
turpitude, treason or bribery ;
(d) being found guilty of misconduct or corruption ;Grounds of
removal ofpersons holdingOffices referred toin section 2.Holders of certain
Offices not to beremoved exceptin accordancewith theprocedure set outin this Act.Short title.

Committee shall have all or any of the following powers :—

of a certificate of deposit, be paid by the holder of

presenting the travellers cheque for encashment.Short title.
